items.title: U.S. Senate passes non-binding vote against Trump’s tariffs on Canada
items.description: Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia, the Democrat pushing the resolutions, said that higher prices caused by tariffs would force Republicans to break with Trump.

items.title: Job vacancies plummet to lowest point since 2017: StatCan
items.description: New data from Statistics Canada suggests there may be more people looking for work than there are jobs available as many businesses report not feeling a need to hire more.

items.title: Wildlife photographer helps save elk trapped in netting in Prince Albert National Park
items.description: Avid wildlife photographer Rod Young reported a bull elk in distress to Prince Albert National Park staff, who then tranquilized the animal and freed it from the man-made netting.

items.title: Brad Marchand comes home to support a grieving N.S. coach and friend
items.description: The Florida Panthers forward, who is from Hammonds Plains, N.S., made a surprise appearance at a minor hockey game in Halifax on Wednesday night. Marchand said he didn't hesitate to come home once he learned his friend's 10-year-old daughter died after a battle with cancer.

items.title: Carney tours newly completed South Korean sub as Canada weighs multi-billion dollar order
items.description: South Korea's prime minister put his political weight behind his country's multi-billion dollar bid to sell Canada submarines. Kim Min-seok accompanied his Canadian counterpart, Mark Carney, on a tour of the Hanwha Ocean Ltd. yard ahead of the APEC summit.

items.title: MPs urge Carney government to release special agency governing documents
items.description: Opposition MPs are calling on Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government to make public the documents that govern three special agencies it has created to manage billions of dollars for major projects, defence procurement and the construction of affordable homes.

items.title: Wait for core Ontario autism services tops 5 years: advocates
items.description: When Ashley Ferreira's five-year-old son was diagnosed with autism in 2020 she never imagined that a five-year for him to get access to government-funded core therapies.

items.title: 1 minute of silence: Inside the Quebec ER that cared for abandoned newborn who died
items.description: A team of doctors ending and starting their shifts at a Longueuil, Que., hospital spent an hour trying to resuscitate a newborn that was abandoned at a bus shelter in the early hours of Monday.

items.title: O Canada! Summer tourism numbers hit all-time high
Canadians are delaying long-term goals to keep up with cost of living: data
items.description: Canadians say it's getting more challenging to save for the future because of the economy and high cost of living, according to new survey data.

items.title: Zellers aims to make ‘cultural comeback' as first store reopens in Edmonton
items.description: Iconic Canadian retailer Zellers returns with a new Edmonton store, blending nostalgia with modern design and curated apparel, home, and lifestyle goods.

items.title: Young, proud, online: Quebec's newest sovereigntists hope to revive an aging movement
items.description: The self-described CEO of the next generation of Quebec sovereigntists is a 17-year-old rapper and TikTok sensation who claims to be more influential than Premier François Legault.

items.title: Photos: Electronic powerhouses Kaytranada and Justice co-headline Rogers Arena
items.description: The DJ and the French duo combined for a memorable show.

items.title: Why the Canadian sport system is in financial disarray
items.description: Limited government funding is among many factors contributing to the state of financial disarray currently embroiling Canadian sport. As a result, National Sports Organizations have had to significantly tighten their belts, making cuts and slashing expenses wherever possible.

items.title: Energy minister hints at support for carbon capture in climate strategy, no mention of emissions cap
items.description: Ahead of the release of Prime Minister Mark Carney’s climate competitiveness strategy, his energy minister offered some hints of what will be included when it's introduced in Tuesday’s budget.

items.title: This Alberta mountain town plays a big role in the fitness watch craze
Alberta labour leaders gauge interest in general strike after suspension of teachers' bargaining rights
Residents prepared for a fight as golf course developer eyes Cape Breton park
items.description: Some in Cape Breton are angry and preparing to fight as a nearby golf course developer eyes the windswept beaches of West Mabou Beach Provincial Park.

items.title: Helping Quebec non-profits below ‘cybersecurity poverty line' strengthen networks
items.description: Facing the threat of cyberattacks and with limited budgets, non-profit organizations across Quebec are being offered free cybersecurity consulting sessions.
